subject: Medicine
title: William Harvey and Blood Flow
description: A fast breakdown of William Harvey and Blood Flow for builders.

hook.text: For 1,400 years doctors believed the liver made fresh blood daily and the body consumed it like fuel.

buildup.text: William Harvey calculated that the liver would need to produce 540 pounds of blood per hour.

discovery.text: Blood doesn't get consumed. It circulates in a closed loop, pumped by the heart.

twist.text: Harvey couldn't see capillaries connecting arteries to veins. He was right without full proof.

climax.text: Decades later, the microscope revealed capillariesâ€”confirming circulation exactly as he described.

punchline.text: Sometimes logic sees what eyes cannot yet.

quiz.question: What did William Harvey prove about blood?
options: It circulates in a closed loop pumped by the heart
The liver produces new blood every day
Blood carries oxygen from the lungs
